text: Big milestone: 1M+ researchers have now made use of #AlphaFold in their vital work, in the 18 months since we made it freely available. From antibiotic resistance to crop sustainability, it's been amazing to see the impact of ‘Science at Digital Speed’: https://unfolded.deepmind.com/#stories

Super cool use of #AlphaFold from the world famous @zhangf lab to help them develop a novel molecular syringe that could act as a new type of drug delivery system that could potentially target things like cancer cells! https://genengnews.com/insights/natures-needle-feng-zhangs-team-re-engineers-bacterial-syringes-for-programmable-protein-delivery/…

We're expanding access to Bard in US + UK with more countries ahead, it's an early experiment that lets you collaborate with generative AI. Hope Bard sparks more creativity and curiosity, and will get better with feedback. Sign up: http://bard.google.com

Join us tomorrow at 10 a.m. to hear from @demishassabis , CEO and Founder of @DeepMind share how #AI is advancing scientific discovery and shaping the future of innovation at #GTC23. https://nvda.ws/3FxiWAO

In @ScienceMagazine , we present #AlphaCode - the first AI system to write computer programs at a human level in competitions. It placed in the top 54% of participants in coding contests by solving new and complex problems. How does it work? https://dpmd.ai/alphacode-science…

#AlphaCode—a new #AI system for developing computer code developed by @DeepMind —can achieve average human-level performance in solving programming contests. Learn more this week in Science: https://scim.ag/Nn

From AlphaGo’s triumph in 2016 to the breakthrough #AlphaFold system today, AI is helping humanity find ways to tackle some of the world’s toughest challenges. Our CEO @DemisHassabis talks to @annastewartcnn on how machine learning is shaping our future: https://dpmd.ai/3F2w7J0

Congratulations to our team behind the Chinchilla language model for winning an Outstanding Paper award at #NeurIPS2022! The scaling laws of large models have been updated and this work is already helping create leaner, better ones for the future: https://dpmd.ai/chinchilla-neurips…

Introducing DeepNash - the first AI to master Stratego, a game of hidden information which is more complex than chess, Go and poker. Published in @ScienceMagazine , it uses a novel model-free reinforcement learning algorithm. Here's how it works. https://dpmd.ai/deepnash-tw

In @Nature : making a traversable wormhole with a quantum computer. A qubit teleported across our Sycamore processor exhibits the dynamics expected from crossing a traversable wormhole, opening up possibilities to test quantum gravity theories. #GoogleAI https://ai.googleblog.com/2022/11/making-traversable-wormhole-with.html…

How could AI become as curious as humans? At #NeurIPS2022, we're presenting a simple and scalable generalization of curiosity-driven exploration to help agents tell the difference between “noise” and “novelty - and stay robust in uncertain environments: https://dpmd.ai/3V2KbsT

IsomorphicLabs is headed to #NeurIPS2022. @maxjaderberg and @SergeiIakhnin will be at the @DeepMind booth Wednesday 12:30 - 14:00 to give an update about Iso and talk all things #MachineLearning in #DrugDiscovery. Hope to see you there! @NeurIPSConf .

How can we get language models to solve maths problems accurately with correct, human-interpretable reasoning? We evaluate many ways to supervise the reasoning process or final answer, leading to state-of-the-art results on the GSM8K benchmark: https://dpmd.ai/3VA4iyo

Big congrats to @DeepMind on their #AlphaTensor breakthrough! Matrix multiplication is fundamental to modern computation and computer tasks, but the question of how to make this process faster, more efficient has been an open question in math for 50+ years.

Congrats to @DeepMind for developing AlphaTensor, a truly remarkable application of deep reinforcement learning to algorithm discovery. These are early steps in AI inventing new ideas in math and physics worthy of a Nobel Prize and Fields Medal. We live in exciting times!

Since 1969 Strassen’s algorithm has famously stood as the fastest way to multiply 2 matrices - but with #AlphaTensor we’ve found a new algorithm that’s faster, with potential to improve efficiency by 10-20% across trillions of calculations per day!
Turns out everything is a matrix multiplication from computer graphics to training neural networks :) Our latest front cover @Nature paper on #AlphaTensor here: https://dpmd.ai/nature-alpha-tensor…

The @ARIA_research CEO selection process had two independent panelists: - Arati Prabhakar, was appointed Biden's Chief Science Adviser a year later. - Carolyn Bertozzi just won the Nobel Prize Correlation != causation, but working with ARIA seems to be a good bet… ;)
The art of playing pool by using physics and geometry https://twitter.com/TheNeva_/status/1577295458640302084/video/1…

New research shows that learned force fields are ready for use in catalyst discovery. Here, ‘Easy Potentials’ outperform classical quantum chemistry tools on the #OpenCatalyst challenge and find lower energy structures outside of the training set: https://dpmd.ai/dm-easy-potential… 1/2

Calling all fans of DeepMind: The Podcast…we’ve been named as a finalist for a People’s @lovieawards ! If you enjoyed our exploration of AGI, robotics, the Serengeti (& more) with the wonderful @FryRsquared , vote for us at https://dpmd.ai/lovie-awards #Lovies 1/
Discover how @pedrobeltrao from @ETH_en is using #AlphaFold to understand the origins of life, and the traits that make us who we are: https://dpmd.ai/Pedro-TW

Acme, a framework for distributed RL research, has been updated to be cleaner, more modular, and to support more agents - including offline & imitation. Try it yourself! GitHub: https://dpmd.ai/acme-github Quickstart: https://dpmd.ai/acme-quickstart V2 Paper: https://dpmd.ai/acme-paper 1/

Dreaming up revolutionary new proteins with AI “Since #AlphaFold there’s been a shift in the way we work with protein design,” says Noelia Ferruz, a computational biologist at the University of Girona, Spain. “We are witnessing very exciting times.”

We’re partnering with six education charities and social enterprises to co-create a bespoke pre-university programme to help tackle the gaps in #STEM education. @Raspberry_Pi @Stemettes @STEMLearningUK @BrilliantClub @BritSciAssoc @AppsforGood Learn https://dpmd.ai/pre-uni

In a move that has stunned biologists, DeepMind says its AlphaFold artificial intelligence can predict the structure of almost all proteins known to science, a discovery that will revolutionise the field and speed drug development.
"DeepMind’s feat may have taken several years of scientific exploration, but it produced something with truly monumental consequences."

Thanks @TEDchris - I think AI is going to help bring about an amazing future through things like accelerating scientific discovery. Thanks @stevenbjohnson for a fascinating and wide-ranging conversation!

I love this idea from @demishassabis in the new TED Interview: the measure of true AI creativity is not whether it can come up with new strategies for chess or Go, but whether it can invent a new game that is as captivating as Go. https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-ted-interview/id1437306870?i=1000570329535…
“We call it science at digital speed.” @demishassabis tells @kncukier how DeepMind’s AI system predicted the structure of almost all known proteins, on our “Babbage” podcast

Interested in exploring the limits of large-scale models? Consider joining our brand new Scalable Deep Learning team in California as a Research Engineer or Research Scientist, see job descriptions below! https://boards.greenhouse.io/deepmind/jobs/4452868?t=bbda0eea1us… https://boards.greenhouse.io/deepmind/jobs/4445808?t=bbda0eea1us…

This quote from @demishassabis is my favourite take on the "engineering vs science" debates in AI yet: AI is an engineering science: unlike in natural sciences, the phenomenon you're studying doesn't exist in nature, so you have to build it first, and then you can study.

It’s been so inspiring to see the scientific community make use of #AlphaFold to help accelerate progress on a huge range of important problems from tackling antibiotic resistance to plastic pollution. They share some of their fascinating stories here:
AlphaFoldhas determined the structures of proteins from almost every known organism on Earth.

A new era of digital biology @ScienceMagazine by @johnstravis https://science.org/content/article/new-era-digital-biology-ai-reveals-structures-nearly-all-known-proteins… w/ @ewanbirney @embl @emblebi @demishassabis @DeepMind
This is a big deal. DeepMind has predicted the structure of almost every protein known to science—and it's giving the data away for free.
DeepMind uncovers structure of 200m proteins in scientific leap forward

The AI lab DeepMind, which is owned by Alphabet, has released predictions for the shapes of nearly every protein known to science. Now, it has added more than 200 million predictions to an online database freely available to scientists across the globe.

One year after open-sourcing its AlphaFold Protein Structure Database, @DeepMind and @emblebi are expanding it from nearly 1M to over 200M protein structures, covering almost every organism that has had its genome sequenced, a huge milestone.

Today is a BFD triumph in life science—solving the 3D structure at near atomic level resolution, one of the world's hardest, giant jigsaw puzzles—the nuclear pore complex—the largest molecular machine in human cells, with structure-based AI prediction @ScienceMagazine

In 2019 we helped optimise @Google ’s wind power fleet, using ML to predict next day power output and help boost the value of wind energy. Now @GoogleCloud is offering this service to partners, helping accelerate the adoption of wind power. Learn more: https://dpmd.ai/3GVLDHf
Use this guide to get started with AlphaFold using #VertexAI and enable a secure, scalable, and configurable environment for your research in the Cloud today ↓
From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! Not only for yesterday but for the support the whole season, I love you Reds

As you become an adult, you realize that things around you weren't just always there; people made them happen. But only recently have I started to internalize how much tenacity *everything* requires. That hotel, that park, that railway. The world is a museum of passion projects.

Today in @SciReports , the graph imputer, a new model that can predict where players will run, on and off-screen, using past and future available observations of subsets of players: https://dpmd.ai/multiagent-football… #AISports 1/

MuJoCo is fully open source! The fast, free physics simulator, designed for research, is now open for contributions. Browse, clone, and build from GitHub: https://dpmd.ai/mujoco-os More details https://dpmd.ai/open-sourcing-mujoco… #MuJoCo
In a new blog we hear from @lilaibrahim , COO of DeepMind, as she reflects on her journey as a technology leader and defines key steps to ensuring our technologies benefit the global community:
37 games down... 1 to go

Transformers can achieve few-shot learning (FSL) without being explicitly trained for it. New research shows that FSL emerges only when the *training data* is distributed in particular ways that are also observed in natural domains like language. https://dpmd.ai/39E1UE9 1/
Can’t believe he is gone. Blade Runner and Chariots of Fire are two of my favourite soundtracks of all time. He was a legend. RIP #Vangelis
There are very few crossover projects to interest both me and my academic classicist wife… but this is one!
Congratulations to @demishassabis , John Jumper, and David Baker who will be awarded the Wiley Foundation 20th annual Wiley Prize in Biomedical Sciences on April 1: http://dpmd.ai/Wiley-Prize 1/7

Introducing Ithaca, the first deep neural network for textual restoration, as well as geographical and chronological attribution of ancient Greek inscriptions. Out today in @nature , Ithaca aims to assist historians & better understand ancient history: http://dpmd.ai/Ithaca-blog 1/

As AI becomes increasingly powerful we will be able to use it to tackle ever more complex problems. #AlphaFold is a sign of things to come, I believe we are at the dawn of a new renaissance in science. Really enjoyed the conversation w/ @strwbilly for this great @techreview report
AlphaFold is one of our 10 Breakthrough Technologies this year. Check out the whole package https://technologyreview.com/2022/02/23/1045416/10-breakthrough-technologies-2022/…

Always a pleasure to visit the inspiring @TheCrick - gave a talk on building AGI and how the tech can then be used to advance scientific discovery itself. Fun Q&A too, covering lots of interesting topics & great to see scientists making use of #AlphaFold: https://youtube.com/watch?v=XtJVLOe4cfs…

Check out my latest video on @DeepMind ’s recent “AI for Mathematics” breakthrough that enabled mathematicians to establish new and significant theorems. I cover the knot theory background, machine learning basics, and the Nature paper

Fast, flexible cultural transmission underpins human intelligence. Our team trains an AI capable of real-time cultural transmission in previously unseen navigation tasks. The agent follows expert demos & reproduces them reliably after the expert leaves: http://dpmd.ai/cultural-transmission… 1/
First protein structure prediction, now plasma control in nuclear fusion reactors! Wow, that time on learning games was well spent, @DeepMind and @demishassabis !

Had a great conversation with @craigss for the @EyeOn_AI podcast. We covered everything from how DeepMind’s Science team operates, to our ongoing efforts on some of the most challenging scientific problems.
A long time ago I was sitting in Demis’ office in Russell Square. Demis said he was going to use AI to solve everything. It just seemed so ridiculous that I laughed. Who’s laughing now?

This, my friends, is a Very Big Deal. And, as if by magic, fusion is one of the topics of conversation on the next episode of the DeepMind podcast, hosted by yours truly: https://deepmind.com/learning-resources/deepmind-the-podcast…
Great to see this @FortuneMagazine feature on how we used the AI algorithm MuZero to improve @YouTube 's video compression - congrats to the team for this incredible work!

Proud of our latest work applying AI to Quantum Chemistry published in @ScienceMagazine ! The properties of materials largely depend on their electrons. We introduce a new SOTA functional DM21 (open-sourced) that can accurately model many types of molecules

The #AlphaFold database has doubled in size today & now includes more than 800,000 structures. This is just one more step towards releasing 100+ million protein structures over the next year, that will cover almost every sequenced protein known to science!!

CDS is honored to continue collaboration with DeepMind ( @DeepMind ) in empowering the next generation of AI researchers and in building a stronger, more inclusive AI community. Check out our blog to learn about the benefits of the CDS DeepMind Scholarship.

Today we're releasing three new papers on large language models. This work offers a foundation for our future language research, especially in areas that will have a bearing on how models are evaluated and deployed: http://dpmd.ai/language-modelling-at-scale… 1/

Introducing MIA, a Multimodal Interactive Agent that cooperates and communicates with humans in a 3D virtual world called the Playhouse. MIA trains with imitation & self-supervised learning using 2.94 years of human experience http://dpmd.ai/imitation-learning… http://dpmd.ai/imitation-learning-video… 1/

Introducing Player of Games - general and sound search algorithm that combines game theoretic reasoning and reinforcement learning. PoG learns to play both perfect and imperfect information games while bringing new SOTA result in the game of Scotland Yard
Football without Origi is nothing

Ramanujan is my favourite mathematician. I’ve always loved his intuitive style, seeing hidden patterns in numbers noone else could. It inspired us to wonder about the potential of using AI as a tool to help the intuition of today’s top mathematicians:

So I’m really proud of our latest @Nature paper http://dpmd.ai/nature-maths (also on the cover!) detailing our fantastic collaborations with Maths Profs Williamson, Lackenby, and Juhasz to make surprising and significant discoveries in topology and representation theory
This week in Nature: AI-guided intuition – Machine learning helps inspire mathematicians to derive fresh conjectures. Browse the full issue here: https://nature.com/nature/volumes/600/issues/7887…

Very proud to be supporting the wonderful Alexander Crummell scholarships for students from disadvantaged backgrounds to study at my old Cambridge college @QueensCam - I warmly encourage all eligible students to apply, my undergrad time there was the best 3 years of my life!

Many single protein chains can be accurately predicted using AlphaFold, but multi-chain protein complexes remain challenging. Introducing AlphaFold-Multimer, a model that can predict the structure of multi-chain protein complexes with increased accuracy http://dpmd.ai/alphafold_multimer… 1/
Great article from @_RobToews AlphaFold Is The Most Important Achievement In AI—Ever via @forbes

Published today in @naturemethods together with colleagues from @calico : Enformer - a transformer model that has led to greatly increased accuracy in predicting gene expression from DNA sequence. Blog: http://dpmd.ai/enformer Paper: http://dpmd.ai/naturemethods_enformer… 1/

We joined a large community effort to assess diverse applications of AlphaFold 2 in the context of novel structural elements; missense variants; function and ligand binding sites; modelling of interactions and experimental structural data. Some highlights below:

Predicting the weather accurately is important for climate and environment planning. Really proud to see our SOTA generative model for predicting rainfall 1-2 hours ahead (nowcasting) published in @nature . Great work from @shakir_za & team in collaboration w/the @metoffice

Applications for internships are now open Interning at DeepMind offers a unique opportunity to closely collaborate with our team & work on various projects that aim to advance science and benefit humanity. Interested? Learn more:

ALGORITHM magazine is your guide to the UK's AI ecosystem. It showcases the solid partnership between gov't, industry & academia, and explains the next steps we're taking to strengthen the UK's role as a science superpower. #NationalAIStrategy http://gov.uk/government/publications/national-ai-strategy-promotional-material…

AI could deliver transformational benefits for the UK and the world - accelerating science and unlocking progress on key challenges facing society. Great to see the scale of the opportunity recognised in the UK #NationalAIStrategy - excited to see how it translates into action!
Congrats to the cast and crew of The Queen’s Gambit for their incredible 11 Emmy wins — including outstanding limited series!

We are very impressed with how good #Alphafold is at predicting protein-protein interactions. A few tricks on the alignment, reranking models, and using the older model make a significant improvement. See our preprint at

A historic moment in the world of molecular structural research. #AlphaFold structure predictions for 22 species made freely available by @deepmind , access through @uniprot and @PDBeurope . Learn more at https://insideuniprot.blogspot.com

DeepMind’s AI predicts structures for a vast trove of proteins. 365,000 today - including the entire human proteome - and upwards of 100 million by year's end, ie much of UNIPROT. https://nature.com/articles/d41586-021-02025-4…

Thanks Ewan, to you and all the wonderful folks at @emblebi for your incredible partnership, one of the best collaborations we have ever had. An absolute (and ongoing) privilege and pleasure working with you all!
A personal view point on the #AlphaFold announcement today from the @DeepMind and @emblebi team, part of @embl . TL;DR - I am *still* pinching myself about this.
University of Portsmouth joins leading AI researchers at @DeepMind to help engineer faster acting enzymes for recycling some of the worlds most polluting single use plastics @CEI_UoP @UoPPlastics
text

Thrilled to see @DeepMind release the #AlphaFold Protein Structure Database! Having already used their cutting-edge tech to accelerate our research for the world's most neglected patients, we’re inspired to see it made available for everyone to use! #NTDs #beatNTDs
Today, @deepmind in partnership with @emblebi launches the #AlphaFold Protein Structure Database in a landmark moment for UK science
In giant leap for biology, DeepMind has published A.I.-predicted protein structures for almost the entire human proteome as well as the proteomes of 20 other organisms.
Thanks for your fantastic partnership Sundar, and all the wonderful support and encouragement from everyone at Alphabet & Google

“I see this as the culmination of the entire 10-year-plus lifetime of DeepMind” — @demishassabis on DeepMind’s latest work in protein-folding: publishing the entire human proteome online, with 100 million more protein structures to come. Full story here:

EMBL and @DeepMind have partnered – a breakthrough for science. Together, we're providing a treasure trove of protein structure predictions powered by #AlphaFold to herald a new era for #AI-enabled biology. https://embl.org/news/science/alphafold-database-launch/…

@DeepMind is blowing our mind every single post is a revolution !! Congrats @demishassabis ! You are inspiring a whole generation of young visionaries. #deepmind #alphafold2 #alphafold #AI #ArtificialIntelligence #AGI
Simple translation: What google did for search, this does for proteins

This is a day I’ve dreamed of my whole life, this is the reason @DeepMind was founded, to build AI and use it accomplish extraordinary scientific breakthroughs like #AlphaFold 2, to advance science and benefit humanity. I could not be more proud of the incredible team!
An incredibly inspiring and moving tribute to mark #LouGehrigDay, which makes us immensely proud to be part of Project Euphonia.

I love this video demonstrating how learnt motor control can enable team level coordination in a 2v2 MuJoCo humanoid soccer domain (the paper's a great read too :). Congratulations to the whole @DeepMind Embodied Intelligence team!
Ocean spaceport Deimos is under construction for launch next year

Introducing AndroidEnv, an open-ended platform for training agents on Android apps and games. With a universal touchscreen interface, access to the entire OS, and a number of ready-to-use tasks, AndroidEnv is a promising domain for RL research: https://deepmind.com/research/publications/androidenv…
I’d be happy to throw my hat in the ring for #Eurovision 2022

Ever wondered what the future of AI looks like? @FryRsquared and @pushmeet , Head of AI for Science at @DeepMind are heading to @CheltSciFest to reveal what AI can tell us about the world around us, including a 50-year old mystery... Book now: https://bit.ly/3ouO762

In a new paper, our team tackles a fundamental AI problem: how can we simultaneously parse the world into objects and properties, while simultaneously inducing the rules explaining how objects change over time: http://dpmd.ai/3fmrxsn (1/)

Can robots imitate humans, just by observing them? Our robotics team explores, in the context of manipulation, how to provide robots with the perceptual ability to mirror a demonstration even when it's from a different embodiment or domain (sim/real): http://dpmd.ai/3tIWqw1 (1/)
this is why we love watching football!! I've never seen a keeper score like that in a live match. incredible. after the really tough season we have had, 4th would feel like a minor triumph...
Congratulations to @demishassabis who has been named as one of @FortuneMagazine 's 2021 World's Greatest Leaders for his contributions to DeepMind's most impactful scientific breakthroughs!

A reminder that we are welcoming applications for the Alexander Crummell Scholarships for postgraduate courses until May 31st 2021 for October 2021 entry More info: https://queens.shorthandstories.com/help-with-your-postgraduate-study-----the-alexander-crummell-scholarships--at-queens--college--cambridge/index.html… Further particulars: https://queens.cam.ac.uk/applying-here/graduates/funding-scholarships-awards/alexander-crummell-scholarships…
I wrote about DeepMind's move into football, its work with Liverpool FC, and its attempts to create an automated virtual assistant coach, for @WiredUK
Today we published our 2020 environmental report. A brief thread. @google

This summer Vladimir Kramnik and @vishy64theking will face each other in an innovative chess variant, proposed by Kramnik: No-Castling #chess. There is one simple rule change – no castling allowed, everything else remains the same!

Students in the UK! @stsucl , @Windsor_Fellows , @ICComputing , @QMUL , @unibirmingham and @EdinburghUni are all currently accepting applications for DeepMind scholarships. Find out more about the application process and important deadlines today: http://dpmd.ai/scholarships

We are delighted to announce that @DeepMind have renewed their commitment to prospective @UCL Master’s students from underrepresented backgrounds for the 2021/22 academic year. Scholarships for courses beginning in September are available in @stsucl , @uclcs , and @uclbiosciences !

Huge congratulations to John Jumper for being included in the @TIME 100 Next list for his tremendous contribution to #AlphaFold and its potential to accelerate biological research. Very well deserved! #Time100Next

Very happy to see @DeepMind 's scholarship program extending to LATAM. The work for @Khipu_AI and connections created there played an important role in this collaboration. @unicampoficial is my alma mater university, so this feels even more special to me :-) #DiversityAndInclusion

Introducing NFNets, a family of image classification models that are: *SOTA on ImageNet (86.5% top-1 w/o extra data) *Up to 8.7x faster to train than EfficientNets to a given accuracy *Normalizer-free (no BatchNorm!) Paper: http://dpmd.ai/06171 Code: http://dpmd.ai/nfnets

Thank you @DeepMind for a fascinating presentation on how #AlphaFold - a UK-led breakthrough in protein folding - can accelerate scientific discovery & be used to support the development of new treatments and drug discoveries. A simply mind-blowing step forward!

Thrilled to be releasing Alchemy, a new benchmark task for meta-RL, abstract structure learning, & latent-state inference. In the paper, researchers show that Alchemy presents a formidable challenge even for state-of-the art RL agents. Game on! http://dpmd.ai/alchemy

The fruition of a lot of work over the past year, a new benchmark task for meta-reinforcement learning: Alchemy! Train agents or play it yourself, this environment comes with interesting latent structure that encourages experimentation and structure learning
Great short video from the @UKRI_News on #AlphaFold explaining the impact it might have on understanding protein structure and the wider implications for the field

Biology's ImageNet moment has arrived: #AlphaFold2 solves Protein Folding at the #CASP14 competition! Blog: https://deepmind.com/blog/article/alphafold-a-solution-to-a-50-year-old-grand-challenge-in-biology…
What a morning for science and technology! More excellent Moderna vaccine news and DeepMind makes a giant leap in single domain protein structure prediction. Humans are awesome!

The artificial intelligence lab DeepMind built a computer system that can identify the shape of a protein in mere hours. This long-sought breakthrough could accelerate the ability to understand diseases and help develop new medicines.

. @DeepMind 's incredible AI-powered protein folding breakthrough will help us better understand one of life’s fundamental building blocks + enable researchers to tackle new and hard problems, from fighting diseases to environmental sustainability.

Thrilled to announce our first major breakthrough in applying AI to a grand challenge in science. #AlphaFold has been validated as a solution to the ‘protein folding problem’ & we hope it will have a big impact on disease understanding and drug discovery: http://deepmind.com/alphafold-blog

The ultimate vision behind @DeepMind has always been to build AI and then use it to help further our knowledge about the world around us by accelerating the pace of scientific discovery. For us #AlphaFold represents an exciting first proof point of that thesis.

Congratulations to the whole #AlphaFold team! And thanks to John Moult and the fantastic CASP organisers and community for championing this critical problem and creating such an amazing benchmark - it really is the gold standard for scientific assessment. #CASP14

Great piece from @sundarpichai on the important work that @Google & @DeepMind are doing to help combat climate change. Proud of our contributions using AI to efficiently cool data centres, optimise industrial building ctrls, & better predict wind output

New @royalsociety DELVE report on "Data Readiness: Lessons from an Emergency" now available. Lots of fantastic people involved in drafting, but particularly @ulrichpaquet , Jessica Montgomery and Stephen Hansen.

Our researchers want to create agents that can achieve goals in a wide range of environments. See how they use @Unity3d to construct diverse simulated worlds - providing environments in which multiple simultaneous agents can pursue separate goals: http://bit.ly/36LZ3UA
Nullius in Verba @royalsociety

President of the Royal Society Venki Ramakrishnan has urged @BorisJohnson to commit to the EU's Horizon Europe programme, to protect the UK's science capability and secure the vision of the country as a "global science superpower".

Highly recommend binge watching the new Netflix series Queen's Gambit, beautifully filmed, stunningly acted, and a pretty accurate portrayal of what it is like to be a child chess prodigy. Not surprising given that the brilliant @Kasparov63 was a consultant on it! #QueensGambit

It's been a difficult year, but there are a couple things I'm genuinely proud of - this paper is one. With @rpascanu, @drao64, and @andreialexrusu , we took our time and thought carefully about continual learning. Hopefully the result is an insightful, or at least enjoyable, read!

Global representation is key to building a stronger and more inclusive AI industry. I’m very proud that the DeepMind scholarship programme has grown to include universities across the world from many regions that have been historically underrepresented in our field.

Exciting results from our partnership with @googlemaps ! Using advanced Graph Neural Networks we were able to improve the accuracy of ETAs in major cities across the world by up to 50% https://bit.ly/2Z0IMYC
We've just released code for PolyGen, our generative model of 3D meshes github: https://github.com/deepmind/deepmind-research/tree/master/polygen…
Sauron still good

Performance gains in hierarchical RL depend on many factors. Introducing a robust off-policy RL framework which unifies training flat Gaussian policies, mixture policies & option policies - independently adding action abstraction & temporal abstraction: https://bit.ly/3idv77D

Very exciting news! We have an opportunity to lead a team of outstanding Research Engineers. If you have software engineering skills, experience in leading research teams and are interested in contributing to our goal of solving AGI https://bit.ly/3h9slQV #AI #deepmind

How can we make #reinforcementlearning agents learn faster? A new article published in @PNASNews proposes a divide-and-conquer approach to RL that allows an agent to combine the solution of known tasks to quickly solve new ones: https://bit.ly/2Q2vXbl

Our researchers are excited to announce the release of two more JAX libraries: Optax for optimisation, and Chex for writing better tests and reliable code. Optax: https://bit.ly/3iRC8vt Chex: https://bit.ly/323xJyu

New @royalsociety DELVE report led by Sir Nick Stern & Sir Tim Besley (top economists) say pitting health v economy is false. “It is wrong to assume that the only way to get the economy back on its feet is through an excessive loosening of restrictions.”

To ensure that AI is a technology of global benefit, increasing African participation is vital. We’re very excited to announce DeepMind’s first scholarship programme on the African continent with @StellenboschUni . Read more about it here: https://bit.ly/3kCMZv0

Videos like this will always amaze me... Astronomer Jan Koet captured this video in 2007 of Saturn appearing behind the Moon. Nothing like seeing the movement of planetary bodies through space to remind us that we're living in a Solar *System* Source: http://bit.ly/3fCWTci

We are hiring three Senior Policy Advisors to join the @royalsociety policy team, working across #emergingtech, #AI, #data, #digital and #innovation. Details here - please share! https://careers-royalsociety.icims.com/jobs/1393/senior-policy-adviser/job?mobile=true&width=375&height=626&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=0&jun1offset=60…
This reinforces our hope that it may be possible to draw biologically relevant conclusions from AlphaFold predictions. Congrats to everyone involved!

We’ve posted an updated version of our SARS-CoV-2 structure predictions, and discuss how well our prediction of ORF3a matched experimental data recently released by @kerndm and the Brohawn lab @berkeleyMCB . Read more in the updated post: https://bit.ly/31l0wOC

Great work from @RoyalSociety DELVE effort: new open-licence international dataset on COVID-19, which will hopefully be a useful resource for the scientific community. Still much to learn about this virus and responses to it - data-driven approaches have an important part to play

Interested in playing around with RL? We’re happy to announce the release of Acme, a light-weight framework for building and running novel RL algorithms. We also include a range of pre-built, state-of-the-art agents to get you started. Enjoy! https://bit.ly/2MlfeOA

As part of #AtHomeWithAI, we’ve brought back the DeepMind x @ai_ucl lecture series! We have 6 new videos covering everything from machine learning and AI to neural networks and image recognition. Visit our YouTube page to watch them all today! https://bit.ly/3eI6uyp

And why did Japan do so well without a lockdown and so little testing? Masks. They gave masks out to 50 million households. An expert panel believes this was the main reason for their success. https://japantimes.co.jp/news/2020/05/28/national/science-health/masks-helped-fight-coronavirus/#.Xs_7zi-z3M2… by @IsabelRTokyo

The success of test, trace and isolate (TTI) programmes depends on speed, compliance and monitoring, says a new report from independent multi-disciplinary group DELVE, convened by the Royal Society. #COVID19 https://royalsociety.org/news/2020/05/success-of-test-trace-and-isolate-programmes-depends-on-speed-compliance-and-monitoring/…
Awesome and beautiful! excited to watch the launch tomorrow, good luck and godspeed @elonmusk , @SpaceX and @NASA

Thrilled to be shortlisted for the @britpodawards ! Congrats to @FryRsquared , @WhistledownProd & everyone who helped us create our first podcast series - especially all of our listeners! We hope you enjoyed listening as much as we enjoyed creating it. (1/2)

In our latest work, published in @NatureMedicine , we collaborated with @Moorfields & @GoogleHealth to train an AI system that could help predict the development of sight threatening age-related macular degeneration. https://nature.com/articles/s41591-020-0867-7…

"Evidence-based decision making should absolutely be a cornerstone of government, especially in a pandemic... However, we must recognise both the potential and the limits of science." Venki Ramakrishnan PRS speaks out on ‘following the science’. https://royalsociety.org/blog/2020/05/following-the-science…

For students and others interested in expanding their knowledge of AI during this period, we thought it might be helpful to ask our researchers what they consider to be the most impactful and insightful resources available to use #AtHomeWithAI (1/9)

Average branching factor (move options) in chess is 35. In Go, it's 250. Some days I wake up and think: did we really solve Go with a learning-based approach or was it all just a dream? What David Silver and @DeepMind achieved with AlphaGo & AlphaZero is still magical to me.
Looking to expand your knowledge of artificial intelligence? Our YouTube page has options for viewers at every stage of their AI journey. (1/4) Watch them here: https://bit.ly/3cs2Wiq #AtHomeWithAI

Enjoyed this @NewInChess review on how #AlphaZero has influenced the phenomenal World Chess Champion @MagnusCarlsen , by his coach, the brilliant @PHChess It has loads of illustrative games from his incredible unbeaten run in 2019! https://newinchess.com/media/wysiwyg/product_pdf/873.pdf…
If you want to find out more #AlphaZero, I recommend checking out the great Game Changer book by @gmmds & @NatashaRegan123

‘Mapping the future’: our recent paper, which provides insight into previously unexplained elements of dopamine-based learning in the brain, is on the front cover of @Nature ! Read the blog: https://deepmind.com/blog/article/Dopamine-and-temporal-difference-learning-A-fruitful-relationship-between-neuroscience-and-AI…
Our @DeepMind Scholars for 2019/20 reveal their aims for the future and what motivated them to study the Cambridge MPhil in Advanced Computer Science: http://ow.ly/KUAN50y7Xp3 #AI #ComputerScience

New lecture series We've teamed up with @ai_ucl to bring you the #UCLxDeepMind Deep Learning Lecture Series: 12 lectures covering a range of topics in Deep Learning - all led by DeepMind researchers, all free, and all open to everyone. Info & tickets:
#NotFakeNews
“A watershed moment for protein structure prediction” Great commentary from @MoAlQuraishi on @DeepMindAI ’s AlphaFold system, published in @Nature this week.

It’s not every day that one gets to celebrate two papers published in the same issue of @Nature ! Huge congratulations to all the amazing people and teams at @DeepMindAI who work so hard and dedicatedly to create this kind of highly innovative scientific research, day in, day out!

Understanding how proteins fold is a fundamental scientific question that could one day help unlock treatments for a range of diseases. Excited that our #AlphaFold work, which uses deep neural networks to predict protein structures, is published in @Nature today!

Some of @DeepMindAI ’s most fascinating work happens at the intersection of AI and neuroscience. Our paper published in @Nature today is a good example. It takes inspiration from our recent work in Reinforcement Learning to shed new light on how dopamine works in the brain.
The effect can now handle collisions and multiple photos #madewithunity #gamedev #vfx #polaroid
Proud to see #AlphaGo listed by the @NewScientist as one of the top 10 scientific discoveries of the last decade, alongside some other incredible breakthroughs:

Happy New Decade everyone! Hard to believe it is 2020 - feels like the year when the future should be invented. We started @DeepMindAI back in 2010, incredible to see how far AI has come in the last decade, but really this is just the beginning!

High-impact joint research project from @DeepMindAI @GoogleHealth & @CR_UK demonstrating AI can spot breast cancer in screening mammograms more accurately than experts. Published today in @Nature ! http://rdcu.be/bZMTy - a great start to the year & lots more to come... :)

If you’re looking for something to listen to this week, try DeepMind: The podcast. Hear from @jhamrick , @vkrakovna @OriolVinyalsML , @wsisaac and many others from our talented teams. https://apple.co/393Kufo https://spoti.fi/36RXN0t #dmpodcast
Our #AlphaStar research features on the cover of @Nature this week! Read the paper here: http://go.nature.com/2JE3lm1

Congrats @ObumEkeke ! A well deserved inclusion on the @FT ’s 100 most influential black, Asian and minority ethnic leaders in tech list - we’re lucky to have you on the @DeepMindAI team spearheading our important university relations work. #IB100

Honoured to have appeared on the 200th episode of #TheLifeScientific on @BBCRadio4 today to discuss chess, AI, and the future of scientific discovery. Thanks to @jimalkhalili for a great conversation, was a lot of fun! Listen back here: https://bbc.co.uk/programmes/m0009zbj…
If you're based outside the UK, you can listen back on any podcast provider platform including Google Podcasts, Apple Podcasts and Spotify...

Amazing two days at the #BlizzCon #AlphaStar demo. We had great games, chats & discussions with the community. Glad that @ENCE_Serral, @Artosis , @LiquidTLO, and many others could stop by. We felt the @StarCraft magic and will never forget this week! GGWP!
Our demo stations are open! So cool to see people playing #AlphaStar : ) We’ve made a range of agents available, at different skill levels. Can’t wait to see you all. GL HF!

I'm so excited we can finally share this with the world. It's been an incredible experience to work with the @DeepMindAI AlphaStar team and it's a huge honour to be a co-author of this paper. Thank you for everything who made that possible!

It was clear from the start the team deeply respects and cares for StarCraft, not just as researchers, but also as gamers. I always looked forward to my visits to the @DeepMindAI offices. Everyone in the team has always been so kind. I'm grateful for such an incredible experience
Can't wait to talk more about AlphaStar! We'll be on @ThePylonShow at 11:30PDT on Saturday!
Exciting to be mentioned in the #BlizzCon opening ceremony! We prepared a fun mix of #AlphaStar agents available for anyone to play. Come try them out and meet the team in the Arcade!

Really proud to see #AlphaStar published in @nature . Playing the full game of StarCraft II with a pro-approved interface, the system ranked higher than 99.8% of all players – a fantastic achievement! Read our paper here: https://rdcu.be/bVI7G
StarCraft is extremely complicated for machines, with hidden information, a huge search space and real-time play – problems many real-world AI systems would have to overcome.

Our DeepMind podcast is still riding high in the podcast charts. If you'd like to envelop your ears in algorithmy goodness and fill your mind with tales of artificial intelligence then this is the podcast for you. Episode 6 out now. https://deepmind.com/blog/article/welcome-to-the-deepmind-podcast…
In our new blog post, we review how brains replay experiences to strengthen memories, and how researchers use the same principle to train better AI systems:
Thrilled to be able to share what I've been working on for the last year - solving the fundamental equations of quantum mechanics with deep learning!

R2D3 uses demonstrations to solve hard exploration problems in partially observable environments with highly variable initial conditions. It can solve tasks where SOTA methods fail to see a single reward. Paper: http://arxiv.org/abs/1909.01387 Videos & more: https://deepmind.com/r2d3
Congratulations to all of the authors on this year’s shortlist for @ecfchess book of the year, including @gmmds & @NatashaRegan123 for Game Changer, their brilliant book about #AlphaZero

Episode 6 of the #DMpodcast is out!! @FryRsquared talks to @csilviavr , @lilaibrahim , @verityharding @wsisaac about some of the ethical questions AI raises and how to create technology that works for everyone. for a preview or subscribe https://apple.co/2KZXx7B
I spoke to @FryRsquared for the #DMpodcast about why a technology that will impact all of society needs to be shaped by as many perspectives as possible. https://apple.co/2KZXx7B
Have a listen to DeepMind's new podcast! I'm in the first episode talking about the intersection of cognitive science and AI

We're excited to release OpenSpiel: a framework for reinforcement learning in games. It contains over 25 games, and 20 algorithms, including tools for visualisation and evaluation. GitHub: http://github.com/deepmind/open_spiel… Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.09453

Episode 5 of the #DMpodcast is out now! In Out of Lab, @FryRsquared explores some of the challenges and scientific problems that AI could help tackle. for a preview or subscribe https://apple.co/2KZXx7B

Applications are now open for our 2020 Research Scientist and Engineering internships! We offer hands-on experience working collaboratively on projects that push the frontiers of AI and science across a wide variety of teams. Find out more or apply:

After a year of intense effort we are making our way to Nairobi for the 3rd Deep Learning Indaba @DeepIndaba There's a community of people who have given every part of themselves to Raise Africa's voice in AI http://deeplearningindaba.com/committee-2019.html… #SautiYetu #DLIndaba2019 #Masakhane

We’re excited to release episodes 1 - 4 of the #DMpodcast! Get the inside track on some of the big questions and challenges the field is wrestling with today. No need to be an expert - the amazing @FryRsquared speaks to the people behind the science. http://deepmind.com/podcast

VQVAE-2 finally out! Powerful autoregressive models in a hierarchical compressed latent space. No modes were collapsed in the creation of these samples ;) Arixv: http://arxiv.org/abs/1906.00446 With @catamorphist and @vinyals More samples and details [thread]
DeepMind’s @pushmeet spoke to @80000Hours about the importance of building robust and safe AI systems. Listen to the full podcast to find out why a career in machine learning makes a difference:
#SixTimes

Our new @sciencemagazine paper is out!! We trained multiple agents to work together as a team to play Quake III Arena: Capture the Flag. These population-based training methods are proving to be widely applicable, e.g. as an integral part of #AlphaStar: http://deepmind.com/blog/capture-the-flag-science…
In an exclusive 60-minute interview for @chess24com , among many other things, Magnus Carlsen and Jan Gustafsson discussed #AlphaZero's current influence. https://bit.ly/2ZOtd54

Leela Zero (an open source chess program based on #AlphaZero) has just won the top computer chess competition, beating Stockfish in the TCEC15 final https://tcec.chessdom.com Great to see learning systems come out on top. Huge congrats to the @LeelaChessZero team and community!

Great interview with Fan Hui: “Before I played #AlphaGo, I felt like I knew the world, like I knew many things. But afterwards, everything changed. Now I really believe everything is possible, because I saw something that people thought was impossible.” https://inews.co.uk/news/technology/fan-hui-what-i-learned-from-losing-to-deepminds-alphago-google/…

Deep learning has so far relied on massive amounts of supervision. We show that unsupervised representation learning with Contrastive Predictive Coding greatly improves data-efficiency: http://arxiv.org/abs/1905.09272 By @olivierhenaff @catamorphist @CarlDoersch @arkitus and @avdnoord
Such a privilege and so much fun to play some blitz chess against the great Vladimir Kramnik, the former World Chess Champion, (I lost!) and to discuss the unique playing style of #AlphaZero

At #io19, we previewed our @GoogleAI efforts to help detect lung cancer. Today we’re publishing our work in @NatureMedicine showing how these methods could boost chances of survival for many people at risk around the world
The Substitute - @alexandradaisy 's fascinating new artwork - draws on our Grid Cells work published in @nature last year to create a visualisation of the extinct male northern white rhino.
Thanks Nihal! Hope you find the book useful and inspirational! #GameChanger

Since last year, a joint DeepMind and Google project to apply ML to 700 MW of wind power in the central US has so far boosted the value of wind energy by ~20%. Blog post: https://deepmind.com/blog/machine-learning-can-boost-value-wind-energy/…

Today we are excited to release the MuJoCo Soccer environment and accompanying paper, Emergent Coordination through Competition: http://arxiv.org/abs/1902.07151 Environment: https://git.io/dm_soccer Sample gameplay: https://sites.google.com/view/emergent-coordination/home…

“Discover the world by seeking new information and then using the information to build a global world view” - our new NDIGO agent from http://arxiv.org/abs/1902.07685 follows this principle for self-supervised discovery in partially observable and noisy worlds:
Great to see industry and government coming together to support the next generation of AI talent here in the UK @DCMS @beisgovuk #IndustrialStrategy

Most surprising facts about #AlphaStar: 1. A Neural Network can play full StarCraft -- without hard coding 2. Pure imitation learning achieves Gold/Platinum 3. Naive Self-Play "gets stuck", but AlphaStar league yields a GM agent Full highlights: https://youtube.com/watch?v=6EQAsrfUIyo…

Doina Precup is an expert on reinforcement learning with high uncertainty. She is a CCAI Chair, a Senior Fellow in the Learning in Machines and Brains program, Associate Prof @McGillU , leader of @DeepMindAI in #mtl and faculty @MILAMontreal . #WomenInSTEM https://cifar.ca/bio/doina-precup-ai…
Game Changer by @gmmds and @NatashaRegan123 reviewed: https://youtu.be/-bn_SF-WpQU @demishassabis @NewInChess @DeepMindAI Provocative, instructive, inspirational, joyous.

@DeepMindAI and @Cambridge_Trust are offering scholarships to under-represented students to study computer science. Open to female and/or black applicants with an offer for MPhil in Advanced Computer Science, the deadline for 2019 start is 31 March. https://bit.ly/2sUgwGy

In a collaboration with Google Brain, we are releasing the Hanabi Learning Environment: a testbed for collaborative multi-agent learning and theory of mind in the card game Hanabi. Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1902.00506 GitHub:
Did you think your chess app was already pretty good for a computer? Google's DeepMind takes it to the next level

Very excited we get to talk about some of the work of the Google MLIR compiler team in a couple weeks. This new infra is a pretty profound rethink of compiler architecture and design, applicable to many domains. Abstract at the bottom of:

It was a great honour to write an introduction to ‘Game Changer’, the new book by @gmmds , @NatashaRegan123 . The #AlphaZero project has really rekindled my passion for chess and I hope this book does the same for others

Our countdown of the best games of 2018 continues on Christmas with a spectacular game from Alphazero! @DeepMindAI 's creation displays boundless creativity in this attack that overcomes Stockfish! See the full list and play through the games https://chess.com/article/view/the-10-best-chess-games-of-2018…
Great to see #AlphaZero and #AlphaFold mentioned: The science stories that shook 2018

What is #AlphaZero like? Renowned figures of the chess community answer the question -- with a twist: https://youtu.be/BazNQEeqNhU Special thanks to @demishassabis for taking the time to participate in the video and letting me visit the place where AZ was born: the @DeepMindAI HQ!
great analysis from @kingscrusher on a very interesting innovation from #AlphaZero in the very common and highly studied Giuoco Piano opening

I have been watching Matthew Sadler's instructional videos on AlphaZero, on @YouTube . On seeing the engine's games, I feel like I am in the presence of God. There is an extraordinary beauty to these long-term positional sacrifices that it is so fond of making.

@DeepMindAI ’s #WaveNet model has the potential to unlock an incredible diversity of accents and languages globally and it’s very cool to see how that’s already manifesting. Nice work, and a great collaborative effort.
Really enjoyed chatting to @Kasparov63 and @demishassabis for my Guardian piece on the latest chess super programme AlphaZero, why artificial intelligence is a good for us, and where it could go next
‘Creative’ AlphaZero leads way for chess computers and, maybe, science. By @seaningle
Garry Kasparov on #AlphaZero and its games: "It's a real breakthrough in the history of chess computers... I am truly impressed." https://bit.ly/2Uzv4YZ @DeepMindAI @demishassabis

Look out for the brilliant forthcoming book 'Game Changer' published by @NewInChess in Jan 2019 by GM @gmmds and WIM @NatashaRegan123 unpacking the secrets of #AlphaZero’s style https://newinchess.com/game-changer great video analysis too: https://youtube.com/watch?v=JacRX6cKIaY… (2/2)

Superb analysis of Game 3 by Grandmaster @DanielKingChess : “I mean this is unbelievable chess!” “These games are just so fascinating, we can learn so much from them” https://youtube.com/watch?v=kVzxIVd1o_Q… #AlphaZero (1/2)

Using AI to help scientists tackle the big questions and better understand the world around us, has always been my dream and is the reason I’ve dedicated my entire career to building AI. Just the start of the exciting advances I think we will see over the next decade! #AI4Science

High praise from @Kasparov63 , and real wisdom about the relationship between humans and machines: “We must work together to combine our strengths.” Agreed! http://science.sciencemag.org/content/362/6419/1087…
"It’s like discovering the secret notebooks of some great player from the past" says Grandmaster Matthew Sadler @gmmds in a great article from @sarahknapton
Watch the inside story of #AlphaZero - including the thoughts of @NatashaRegan123 and @gmmds - in this film

**NEW PODCAST KLAXON!** The Disrupters - presented by me & ⁦⁦@bbckamal⁩, telling the stories of the most inspiring entrepreneurs. First episode is on AI genius ⁦ @demishassabis ⁩. Hope you like it - let us know what you think!

Pleasure to be back at #BlizzCon! Great discussion with @day9tv about why @StarCraft II is such an incredible AI research platform and a natural progression from DeepMind’s work on Atari and Go. @Blizzard_Ent

We’re announcing our AI for Social Good program, applying @GoogleAI expertise to projects w/ positive societal impact. We invite researchers & orgs to submit ideas for the #GoogleAI Impact Challenge: @googleorg will fund $25M in grants to chosen projects

Check out #Alphago on Netflix. It's the story of how DeepMind AI beat a top level Go champion. I started it just wanting to understand the game. Didn't know it was going to be as thrilling as Rocky IV. What an amazing work of direction, editing and scoring. Thank you @ReelAsDirt

Excited to release our new multi-agent RL paper showing that when agents receive a social reward for having causal influence over other agents, it leads to enhanced cooperation and emergent communication
We should be optimistic but never complacent about the positive potential of AI, DeepMind COO @lilaibrahim writes in the @nytimes
We've just released our Graph Nets library for deep learning on graphs: http://github.com/deepmind/graph_nets…. For more about Graph Nets, see our paper: http://arxiv.org/abs/1806.01261
Just finished watching the AlphaGo documentary on Netflix. If you have any interest in Artificial Intelligence, it’s a must see. Amaaaazing film

Today we're open sourcing TRFL, a library of building blocks for reinforcement learning agents - containing key algorithmic components of many of our most successful RL agents. GitHub: https://github.com/deepmind/trfl/ Blog post: http://deepmind.com/blog/trfl

Had a really enjoyable conversation at @royalacademy speaking on a new topic: creativity and AI (new stuff from 29m). Fascinating ideas and dialogue always happens when the arts and sciences come together. Important for society to understand tech advances through both lenses!

The study made the Editor's Choice in Science, nice short summary in the neuroscience section: http://science.sciencemag.org/content/362/6411/twil… Congrats to @dharshsky @raphael_koster @MartinJChadwick and the team!
Blade Runner — Esper Edition — Vangelis https://m.youtube.com/watch?feature=youtu.be&v=SQFRtbDK9Yk…

Congrats @MoxiePictures @ReelAsDirt for winning the Technology & Innovation category for @AlphaGoMovie ! If you haven't seen it yet, you can still watch it on @Netflix @GooglePlay @PrimeVideo #AlphaGo

I'll sign up for these as well. @demishassabis "three truths": 1) AI will save us from ourselves 2) AI will lead to Nobel-prize winning science breakthroughs 3) Deep learning is not enough to crack AI https://techrepublic.com/google-amp/article/google-deepmind-founder-demis-hassabis-three-truths-about-ai/…

Large-Scale GAN Training: My internship project with Jeff and Karen. We push the SOTA Inception Score from 52 -> 166+ and give GANs the ability to trade sample variety and fidelity. https://arxiv.org/abs/1809.11096
one of the most important aspects of the work is the interpretability of the system so clinicians can see and understand how the system is making its recommendations

It’s always so uplifting to see the work of our hospital and university partner on the front page @RossLydall @standardnews .Well done @pearsekeane : determination, drive & passion sums it up supported by many @Moorfields @UCLeye @DeepMindAI . Very positive news for our patients.

So proud of the collaboration between the @DeepMind_Health team and the world-class @Moorfields hospital, and the new study published in @NatureMedicine today. Great to see this technology addressing real-world problems, and in the future helping to improve patient outcomes

awesome work from the DeepMind team on scalable verification in deep neural networks - an important step towards provable guarantees of robustness for increasingly general classes of models. huge congrats to Dj, Pushmeet, and the rest of the team! #AISafety
Another brilliant collaborative effort from the DeepMind for Google and Android teams. Great work team!

Neural networks enhanced with Neural Arithmetic Logic Units (NALU) can learn to track time, perform arithmetic over images of numbers, translate numerical language into real-valued scalars, execute computer code, and count objects in images https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.00508
"This gift will benefit the UK more broadly, as AI has such transformative potential in so many aspects of our lives." Cambridge V-C Stephen Toope

Great news: @Cambridge_Uni is to establish a DeepMind Chair of Machine Learning. Together with the £1bn AI sector deal, the Centre for Innovation & Data Ethics and AI Grand Challenge this big step underscores our determination to be at the forefront of this emerging technology.

I have so many wonderful memories from my time as an undergraduate at Cambridge, and it’s now such an honour that @DeepMindAI is able to contribute back to the Department of Computer Science and Technology and support others through their studies @Cambridge_Uni
The AlphaGo team are honoured to be awarded the inaugural Marvin Minsky Medal for Outstanding Achievements in AI at #IJCAI2018 http://ijcai.org/awards/minsky_medal…

Wonderful day at the @royalsociety ! Amazing to sign the 350-year old charter book with all my heroes including Alan Turing. The ultimate honour for a scientist. Was fun to do it with @elonmusk , my postdoc advisor Peter Dayan, and all the other great scientists elected this year

Not immediately obvious that this would be gripping but the Documentary ALPHAGO IS... for gamers and others alike... watch it if you get the chance... it is interesting and heartbreaking and hopeful... https://youtu.be/8tq1C8spV_g #alphago #ThirstForKnowledge

Measuring abstract reasoning in neural networks - our latest #ICML2018 paper - takes inspiration from human IQ tests to explore abstract reasoning and generalisation in deep neural networks https://deepmind.com/blog/measuring-abstract-reasoning/… by @dgtbarrett , Felix Hill, @santoroAI , @arimorcos , Tim Lillicrap

Our latest work is out! Representation Learning with Contrastive Predictive Coding (CPC). Autoregressive modeling meets contrastive losses in the latent space. Learn useful representations in an unsupervised way. -> On Audio, Vision, NLP and RL. Arxiv: https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.03748
You wanted to make history @England and you are doing just that. This has been an incredible #WorldCup run and we’ve enjoyed every minute. You deserve this moment – Football’s Coming Home! W

Since our initial results on Generative Query Networks (GQNs) (https://deepmind.com/blog/neural-scene-representation-and-rendering/…) , we’ve worked on several new extensions and applications, such as few-shot regression, consistent video prediction, camera localisation and text conditioning.

Our latest work demonstrates how agents achieve human-level performance in a complex first-person multiplayer game, and can even collaborate with human teammates! http://deepmind.com/blog/capture-the-flag…

Welcome back, gradients! This method is orders of magnitude faster than state-of-the-art non-differentiable techniques. DARTS: Differentiable Architecture Search by Hanxiao Liu, Karen Simonyan, and Yiming Yang. Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1806.09055 Code: https://github.com/quark0/darts
The challenge of realistic music generation: modelling raw audio at scale - Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1806.10474 - Listen to piano music samples here: http://goo.gl/A9nTZa

Great to have two of our own recognised in the MIT @techreview 35 Innovators under 35 list. Congratulations @mustafasuleymn and Julian Schrittwieser! @Mononofu https://technologyreview.com/lists/innovators-under-35/2018/…
